DOC.brief_title: Surgical Conditions During Vocal Cord Surgery Requiring Jet Ventilation With Moderate v . Deep Neuromuscular Block
DOC.detailed_description: To optimize anatomical exposure minimize direct manipulation local lesion endotracheal intubation often avoid patient undergo vocal cord surgery . Instead intermittent call jet ventilation carry use Hunsaker Mon-jet tube . The safe conduct procedure require full muscle paralysis . In clinical practice , however , deep neuromuscular blockade ( NMB ) usually establish relatively short surgery ( < 1h ) increase risk prolong NMB postoperative ventilation . The novel neuromuscular blockade reversal agent sugammadex may prove particularly useful patient population allow fast reliable reversal even deep NMB . Deeper muscle paralysis vocal cord surgery may associate good surgical condition . The purpose study determine whether deep neuromuscular blockade provide well surgical condition moderate neuromuscular blockade patient undergoing vocal cord resection require jet ventilation .
DOC.criteria: Elective vocal cord resection expect length procedure longer 20 minute require jet ventilation Patients young 18 year old Patients unable give write informed consent Patients know suspected neuromuscular disease Patients allergies medication use anesthesia Patients ( family ) history malignant hyperthermia Patients renal insufficiency ( serum creatinine > 2 time normal glomerular filtration rate < 60 ml/h )
